bug.author: kezakool
bug.summary: Inference Problem in the converted model
bug.description:
Hi, <denchmark-h:h2>üêûDescribe the bug</denchmark-h>
The model is a Keras CNN LSTM with spectrogram inputs and softmax output, the conversion went well, i checked the graph model with visualize_spec and everything seems good too, but when I make a prediction, there is a huge gap in results. I did another try cutting a subgraph before the LSTM layer, and there is still differents results, how is this possible? <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Follow this link (<denchmark-link:https://feedbackassistant.apple.com/feedback/7390376>https://feedbackassistant.apple.com/feedback/7390376</denchmark-link> ) to apple debugging report, you'll find :
a notebook to reproduce the procedure the keras model and the input sample for debug test
<denchmark-h:h2>System environment (please complete the following information):</denchmark-h>
coremltools version : 3.0 OS (e.g., MacOS, Linux): Macos macOS version (if applicable): 10.15 Catalina XCode version (if applicable): 11 How you install python (anaconda, virtualenv, system): virtualenv python version (e.g. 3.7): 3.6 any other relevant information:
Keras version 2.2.4
Tell me if I missed something with the link, i m not sure i made it in the app you suggested. Thanks

comments.comment: Hi, any idea anybody? we re stuck :/ thxs

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kezakool>@kezakool</denchmark-link> , thanks for reporting the issue! The numeric difference is ~0.01 which might be caused by implementation details of activation layers, especially on GPU. Can you try set flag in your call to verify?

You're awesome! it works! thanks! But how was i supposed to find that? :) can it be added to documentation? thank you <denchmark-link:https://github.com/1duo>@1duo</denchmark-link> , you can close the issue
